intro: Rhipidocladum parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered rock cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing, mat-forming species with small, clustered leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and small, ovate leaves. It is often found in coastal or mountainous regions where it contributes to local biodiversity.
